message.content:
cs.FL, cs.DM, cs.LO, cs.IT, cs.CC

The paper deals with the theory of formal languages and automata, which is a core topic in computer science. The use of local divisors is a technique commonly used in algebraic and combinatorial approaches to formal language theory, which suggests the paper may belong to cs.FL (Formal Languages and Automata Theory). The paper also deals with the recognition of languages by finite monoids, which is a topic in algebraic automata theory, suggesting cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) as another likely category. The paper also uses techniques from logic and information theory, which suggests cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science) and cs.IT (Information Theory) as possible categories. Finally, the paper may also be relevant to cs.CC (Computational Complexity) as it deals with the complexity of recognizing star-free languages.
